intro: Phyteuma pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees mountain range. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, and it blooms during the summer months. Phytoema pyrenaicum is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes.
